title: Corporate Governance Practices of Neogenomics Inc

content.text: Neogenomics Inc has a well-balanced board composition that includes a majority of independent directors. As of the latest proxy statement, out of the nine directors on the board, six are considered independent. This ensures that the board is able to provide unbiased oversight and make decisions in the best interest of the company and its shareholders. The independent directors bring diverse expertise and experience from various industries, enhancing the overall governance of the company.

Neogenomics Inc's executive compensation practices are designed to align the interests of executives with those of shareholders. The compensation packages include a mix of base salary, annual bonuses, and long-term incentives such as stock options and restricted stock units. The base salary provides a fixed component, while the annual bonuses are tied to performance goals and metrics, ensuring that executives are incentivized to drive the company's financial and operational success. The long-term incentives further align executive interests with long-term shareholder value creation.
